Name: Lamp Base in form of Temple of Aphrodite
Description: The small terra-cotta lamp base is a model of the Temple of Aphrodite. The style of the facade of the temple is purely Egyptian, having two pairs of columns with capitals in the form of the head of the goddess Hathor below a frieze, or ornamented band, of sacred cobras.The arched pediment, the triangular space that forms the gable of a low-pitched roof, frames the sun disk. Aphrodite, the goddess of love in Greek mythology, is standing half nude inside the temple. Dedicated to the Egyptian goddess Hathor in the form of her Greek counterpart, Aphrodite, the model reveals the fusion of Egyptian and Greek art.
